intro: Justicia calycotricha, commonly known as the velvetleaf false dragonhead, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to blue, often blooming in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners in tropical and subtropical regions.
